ingredients: 6 cups of peeled and sliced apples
cooking_method: Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a large bowl, toss the apples with the sugar, flour, cinnamon, salt and nutmeg.
Pour the apple mixture into the pie crust and dot with butter.
Cover the pie with a second pie crust and crimp the edges.
Cut several slits on the top crust to allow steam to escape.
Bake for 45 minutes or until golden and bubbly.
Let the pie cool slightly before serving.
Cook the macaroni according to the package directions. Drain and set aside.
In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and whisk in the flour. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Gradually whisk in the milk and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the cheese, salt, pepper and paprika until smooth and melted.
Add the macaroni and stir to coat well.
Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 15 minutes or until bubbly and golden.

ingredients: 8 pieces of chicken (legs, thighs, breasts or wings)
cooking_method: Rinse the chicken and pat it dry with paper towels.
In a large bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, salt, black pepper and cayenne pepper. Add the chicken and toss to coat well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or up to overnight.
In another large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, garlic powder and onion powder.
Heat about 3 inches of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until it reaches 350°F.

Working in batches, take the chicken out of the buttermilk and shake off any excess. Dredge in the flour mixture and shake off any excess. Carefully lower into the hot oil and fry for 10 to 15 minutes per side or until golden and cooked through. Drain on paper towels.

ingredients: Lettuce, tomato, cheese, ketchup, mustard and other toppings as desired
cooking_method: In a large bowl, mix the ground beef, onion, bread crumbs, salt and pepper. Shape into four equal patties.
Heat a grill or a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the patties for about 4 minutes per side or until well done.
Toast the buns lightly if desired. Assemble the burgers with the patties and your favorite toppings.

ingredients: Oil or butter for greasing the griddle
Maple syrup, butter, fruit or other toppings as desired
cooking_method: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs and melted butter.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not overmix.
Heat a griddle or a skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with oil or butter.
Drop about 1/4 cup of batter onto the griddle and cook for about 3 minutes or until bubbles form on the surface. Flip and cook for another 2 minutes or until golden and cooked through.
Repeat with the remaining batter, greasing the griddle as needed.
Serve the pancakes hot with your favorite toppings.

ingredients: Optional: chocolate chips, nuts, marshmallows or other add-ins
cooking_method: Preheat oven to 350°F and grease an 8x8 inch baking pan
In a large microwave-safe bowl, melt the butter
Stir in the sugar, eggs and vanilla until well combined
Stir in the cocoa powder, flour, salt and baking powder until smooth
Fold in any add-ins if using
Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan and bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean
Let the brownies cool slightly before cutting into squares and serving
To make the dressing, whisk together the mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, lemon juice, olive oil, anchovy paste, garlic and pepper in a small bowl until smooth and creamy.
To make the salad, toss the lettuce with the dressing in a large bowl until well coated.
Sprinkle with the shaved Parmesan cheese and croutons and serve.

ingredients: 4 slices of cheese (such as cheddar, American or Swiss)
Optional: tomato slices, bacon strips, ham slices or other fillings as desired
cooking_method: Butter one side of each slice of bread.
Heat a skillet over medium-low heat and place one slice of bread butter-side down on the skillet.
Top with two slices of cheese and any fillings if using. Place another slice of bread butter-side up on top.
Cook for about 3 minutes or until golden and crisp on the bottom. Carefully flip and cook for another 3 minutes or until golden and crisp on the other side and the cheese is melted
Repeat with the remaining bread, butter and cheese to make another sandwich.
Cut into halves and serve hot.

ingredients: 1 (15-ounce) can of kidney beans, drained and rinsed
Optional: shredded cheese, sour cream, green onions or other toppings as desired
cooking_method: In a large pot over medium-high heat, heat the oil and cook the onion, bell pepper and garlic for about 10 minutes or until soft, stirring occasionally.
Add the ground beef and cook, breaking it up with a spatula, for about 15 minutes or until browned and cooked through. Drain any excess fat.
Stir in the chili powder, cumin, oregano, salt and pepper and cook for 1 minute or until fragrant.
Stir in the tomato sauce, diced tomatoes and kidney beans and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until slightly thickened.
Serve the chili hot with your favorite toppings if desired.
Preheat oven to 375°F and line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugars together with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs and vanilla and beat well until smooth.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the ,wet ingredients and mix well until a soft dough forms.
Stir in the chocolate chips with a wooden spoon or a spatula.
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheets, leaving some space between them.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden and set on the edges but still soft in the center.
Let the cookies cool slightly on the baking sheets before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

ingredients: 4 cups of corn kernels (fresh, frozen or canned)
cooking_method: In a large pot over medium-high heat, cook the bacon until crisp, stirring occasionally. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate and set aside.
In the same pot, cook the onion, celery, carrots and garlic for about 15 minutes or until soft, stirring occasionally and scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot.
Add the chicken broth and potatoes and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender.

Stir in the corn and half-and-half and bring to a boil. In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and 1/4 cup of water until smooth. Stir into the pot and cook for about 5 minutes or until slightly thickened.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and garnish with parsley and bacon bits before serving.
Preheat oven to 375°F and line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, cream the butter, peanut butter and sugars together with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
Add the egg and vanilla and beat well until smooth.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix well until a soft dough forms.

Shape the dough into one-inch balls and roll them in some granulated sugar. Place them on the prepared baking sheets, leaving some space between them. Flatten them slightly with a fork, making a crisscross pattern on top.
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden and set on the edges but still soft in the center.
Let the cookies cool slightly on the baking sheets before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
